Simba.Action: Bounds excitedly to wake his sleeping father and bumps him affectionately, nudging and playfully tugging his father's ear and tail despite gentle swats.
Bumps and nudges sleeping parents energetically, showing eagerness but lacking subtlety or restraint.
Bounds over excitedly, showing enthusiasm and energy.
Gently pulls on Mufasa's tail and head-butts him to wake him up playfully.
Shows excitement and awe when learning about the kingdom and his future responsibilities.
Runs back to his mother for reassurance before heading up Pride Rock.
Respectfully wakes Mufasa up and follows him with enthusiasm.
Listens attentively to Mufasa’s explanation of kingship and territory.
Asks insightful questions about kingdom boundaries and responsibilities.
Shows innocence and naivety by assuming a king can do whatever he wants.
Is amazed and impressed by the land and creatures around him, showing appreciation for nature.
Shows curiosity about the relationship between eating antelope and respecting all creatures, indicating an open and sincere attitude.
Ignores serious conversation and focuses on chasing a butterfly, showing a playful and lighthearted side.
Listens to Mufasa's explanation about the Circle of Life and considers it thoughtfully.
Ignores Zazu's important morning report and chases a butterfly instead.
Attempts to pounce on a butterfly but misses, showing lack of skill or precision.
Follows Mufasa’s instructions quietly and stealthily attempts to pounce on Zazu, showing playful obedience and engagement.
Expresses disappointment that he cannot go with Mufasa and others, showing vulnerability and openness.
Shows irritation and slight resentment by stating 'I never get to go anywhere' after being told to go home.
Follows Mufasa's instructions carefully, practices pouncing stealthily, and successfully hits his target.
Tries to negotiate with Mufasa to go along when told to stay home, shows some impatience and lack of control.
Approaches Uncle Scar enthusiastically to share news, engages in playful banter.
Shows curiosity about forbidden areas despite warnings, demonstrates innocence and bravery.
Expresses enthusiasm confidently about becoming king and showing no hesitation when talking to Scar.
Asks Scar questions to probe limits and rules, showing curiosity and willingness to learn.
Ignores Scar's caution and restrictions about the dangerous area, suggesting impulsiveness and potential recklessness.
Squirming free when Scar tries to position himself as protective, showing assertiveness but also possible stubbornness.
Laughs off Scar's teasing without insecurity, demonstrating social confidence and ease.
Promises Scar to keep a secret about the dreadful place, showing trustworthiness and sincerity.
Greets Nala enthusiastically and tries to include her in his plans, demonstrating friendliness and good-natured behavior.
Protests being bathed by his mother Sarabi, showing typical childlike annoyance but no rudeness.
Promises Scar not to visit the dreadful place, showing willingness to keep a secret and cautiousness.
Tries to rally Nala to come along to a great place, showing enthusiasm and some social initiative.
Protests and wriggles free from Sarabi’s grooming, showing limited patience and understanding of necessary care.
Quickly recovers after falling, cleans himself properly and requests to leave, showing adaptability and self-care ability.
Deceives Sarabi by lying about where he is taking Nala.
Tries to excite Nala and share an adventurous experience with her.
Shows reluctance and discomfort about Zazu accompanying them, indicating a desire to protect their secret plan.
Refuses the idea of marrying Nala because she is his friend and he finds it weird, and negotiates a 'deal' to avoid unwanted obligation.
Playfully pounces on Zazu showing a friendly, playful side.
Shows defiance and disregard of authority with a dismissive and bossy attitude toward Zazu.
Roars in Zazu's face, blowing/spitting in his eye.
Mocks and teases Zazu by making rude faces behind his back with Nala.
Rides ostriches that run away from Zazu, causing trouble.
Practices roaring and strives to be a great king, demonstrating ambition and focus on skill development.
Roars in Zazu’s face, unintentionally spitting in his eye, showing a lack of awareness and social tact.
Plays mischievously with Nala and outsmarts Zazu by making faces and evading him, showing quickness and playful cleverness.
Rides ostriches recklessly, causing Zazu to be endangered, indicating impulsiveness and disregard for consequences.
Orders animals to move and obey his commands confidently while riding a giraffe’s head.
Plays and leads a chaotic game that traps Zazu repeatedly but remains in control and creative.
Whispers a clever plan to remove the dodo and successfully disrupt Zazu.
Successfully orchestrates a plan to free Zazu and escape, expresses confidence calling himself a genius, and celebrates the teamwork with Nala.
Playfully tussles with Nala, gets flipped and pinned down multiple times, showing lack of control in physical play.
Shares excitement and joy with Nala about discovering the elephant skull.
Invites Nala to explore together despite potential danger, showing camaraderie.
Displays bravado and mocks Zazu's warnings about danger, showing arrogance.
Stands up to the hyenas and asserts his future role as king, defending his territory despite being outnumbered.
Insults the hyenas by calling them "slobbering, mangy, stupid poachers".
Shows trust in his father's word about the hyenas, revealing loyalty and sincerity to family teachings.
Puffs up and confidently declares himself the future king when confronted by the hyenas.
Dismisses the threat posed by the hyenas, underestimating their power and influence.
Argues with the hyenas about territory without a clear plan or backup, showing some boldness but also recklessness.
Slaps Ed away when Ed tries to bite his tail, showing quick reflexes and assertiveness.
Sneaks away with Nala and Zazu unnoticed while the hyenas argue, demonstrating stealth and situational awareness.
Fails to notice immediately that Zazu is not with them while escaping, indicating a momentary lapse in attention.
Calls out bravely to hyenas to defend others despite danger.
Runs and successfully swipes hyena Shenzi to protect Nala.
Cubs struggle to maintain footing on slippery elephant skull and fall, indicating difficulty handling the situation.
Fails to prevent cubs from being cornered at a dead end, showing limited strategic planning.
Tries to roar to protect himself and Nala despite fear and failure.
Shows vulnerability by producing only a weak squeak instead of a roar.
Tries to roar to scare off hyenas but first produces a weak, squeaky sound.
Eventually roars loudly (off-screen) which contributes to the hyenas freezing and retreating.
Immediately apologizes to Mufasa when reprimanded.
Feels dejected and hangs his head after being scolded, showing sensitivity.
Does not argue or defy his father, instead keeps close and submissive.
Remains motionless and sinks into the grass rather than leave with Nala and Zazu.
Disobeys his father’s direct order, leading to reprimand.
Shows remorse and apologizes after being scolded.
Hangs his head and shows dejection, lacks confidence in the moment.
Hesitates to follow instructions promptly (does not move when Zazu and Nala leave).
Edging closer to his father as called, showing willingness to comply after initial hesitation.
Admits he was scared and cries after being reprimanded by Mufasa, showing vulnerability and sincere remorse.
Shows trust and affection by seeking closeness with Mufasa and affirming their bond as pals who will always be together.
Expresses admiration and attempts to emulate Mufasa's bravery, indicating good-natured respect.
Shows remorse and apologizes sincerely after being reprimanded by Mufasa.
Attempts to act brave by taking risks but without full understanding of consequences, putting himself and Nala in danger.
Admits his misunderstanding of bravery and acknowledges he is still learning.
Engages in playful bonding with Mufasa, showing openness to guidance and emotional intelligence.
Responds to Scar's teasing with a shrewd and playful remark, staying composed and confident.
Sits passively on a rock while Scar leads him to a dangerous situation without suspicion.
Offers to go with Scar despite being told no, showing eagerness but lack of judgment.
Centers himself and waits patiently on the rock, showing self-control and obedience.
Attempts to catch the chameleon but misses and gets hit, demonstrating lack of skill and coordination.
Holds a leaf over the chameleon, making it change color, and laughs.
Allows the chameleon to crawl on his arm and face without showing anger, even after being bitten on the nose.
Frantically calls for help when in danger, showing vulnerability and trust in others.
Clings desperately to a branch during a life-threatening situation, showing fear but relying on others.
Runs to his dying father, calls out for help, tries to revive him, shows panic and sorrow, nuzzles him and lies beside him sobbing.
Runs over the rise just in time to see Mufasa disappear; immediately searches for his father and calls for help.
Does not see Scar or realize the deception; panics and sobs beside his father instead of taking action.
Attempts to raise Mufasa’s arm and calls out for help, showing presence of mind despite panic.
Runs a few paces away in panic and then returns; shows confusion and lack of clear plan.
Sobs into his father’s mane, shows vulnerability and grief.
Tries to explain what happened, expresses remorse and helplessness.
Evades hyenas by running, climbs into a crevasse to hide.
Leaps off a cliff edge despite danger, rolls down uncontrollably but survives.
Is sobbing uncontrollably and unsure what to do after his father's death.
Runs flat out to escape from pursuing hyenas, showing urgency and survival instinct.
Separated from hyenas by a painful thorny thicket which he apparently uses to evade capture.
Struggles alone in the desert, fights to survive despite exhaustion and danger.
Fights against a sand storm and trudges through a harsh desert despite near collapse.
Falls faint from exhaustion during the journey.
Is unconscious and vulnerable, implicitly trusts others to help him.
No direct dialogue or action, passive while in danger.
Is unconscious and unable to defend himself against buzzards.
Is rescued by friends despite his vulnerable state.
Thanks Timon and Pumbaa for their help after nearly dying.
Looks forlorn and leaves quietly without engaging further.
Thanks Timon and Pumbaa for their help and attempts to get up and leave despite being disoriented and nearly dead.
Appears disoriented and forlorn, showing signs of depression and lack of clear direction.
Doesn't open up about his past, indicating emotional guardedness.
Listens to Timon and Pumbaa's friendly, welcoming attitude without rejection.
Avoids talking about his past traumatic experience, shows reluctance to confront or share his problems.
Listens and shows interest in new ideas (Hakuna Matata) as suggested by Timon and Pumbaa, indicating openness to learning and adapting.
Follows Timon and Pumbaa into the jungle and adapts to the new environment by engaging with their lifestyle.
Expresses hunger and attempts to request familiar food such as zebra or antelope, showing awareness of his needs but lack of adaptability at first.
Shows initial disgust and hesitation when offered to eat insects (grubs), indicating a struggle to fully adapt to the new survival skills and diet presented.
Accepts Timon's offer of bugs and joins in the carefree 'Hakuna Matata' philosophy, sharing playful moments and camaraderie with Timon and Pumbaa.
Resists initial hesitation and tries eating bugs offered by Timon, showing openness to new experiences and adapting to the jungle lifestyle.
Adopts the 'Hakuna Matata' philosophy, demonstrating a willingness to embrace a carefree mindset and temporarily set aside worries and responsibilities.
Shares a meaningful, sentimental belief about great kings watching over them, showing openness and sincerity.
Laughs along with others when his belief is mocked, indicating a tendency to avoid conflict and maintain harmony.
Asks quietly if the great kings are really there and sighs showing vulnerability and introspection.
Tries to block out his doubts with the mantra 'Hakuna Matata', suggesting avoidance of deeper emotional engagement at the moment.
Jumps into frame and knocks down the lioness to protect Pumbaa and Timon.
Recognizes Nala and gives her a reassuring smile despite initial tension.
Introducing Nala as his best friend to Timon, showing openness and friendly sincerity.
Appears tongue-tied and faltering when surprised to see Nala, revealing vulnerability.
Jumps in and knocks down the lioness, demonstrating physical skill and bravery in a confrontation.
Gets pinned by Nala and initially falters in recognition and speech, showing some hesitation and uncertainty.
Gives Nala a reassuring smile after recognition, showing confidence and emotional intelligence in reconnecting with an old friend.
Introduces Pumbaa to Nala, facilitating social connection.
Tells Timon to relax when Timon expresses concern, showing calmness and tolerance.
Admits to being cagey and suspicious about what Scar told Nala, showing guardedness but also concern.
Feels panic-stricken when Nala insists everyone should know he is alive, indicating internal struggle to be open.
Rejects the idea of being king and tries to downplay his responsibilities, distancing himself from others.
Responds to Pumbaa’s reverent gestures with mild rebuke ('Stop it...'), not encouraging overly submissive behavior.
Calmly tells Timon to relax despite the surprising situation.
Looks panic-stricken and tries to keep his presence a secret from his mother and others.
Responds cagey and suspicious when Nala asks about what Scar told her, showing wariness.
Eventually denies being king and downplays his previous role, showing avoidance and lack of confidence.
Gestures for Timon and Pumbaa to leave Nala and him alone, showing respect for Nala's request for privacy.
Acknowledges Nala’s emotions with gentle reassurance when she becomes tearful and unsure.
Encourages Timon and Pumbaa to learn to love the situation/friends, showing patience and tolerance.
Denies being a king despite others’ insistence, reflecting possible insecurity or reluctance to accept responsibility.
Asserts he is not a king despite others calling him one, showing some uncertainty and lack of confidence.
Gestures for Timon and Pumbaa to leave so he can talk to Nala privately, demonstrating some social awareness and assertive behavior.
Is unsure how to respond when Nala becomes emotional, reflecting insecurity and lack of experience in handling emotional situations.
Comforts Nala gently, showing empathy though not full confidence or decisiveness in his actions.
Invites Nala to a place he likes, tries to share positivity.
Dismisses Nala's concerns about Pride Rock and responsibility.
Uses 'Hakuna Matata' philosophy to avoid worry and responsibility.
Turns away from Nala physically and emotionally when confronted about duty.
Says 'Sorry' after Nala's plea but does not immediately offer help.
Dismisses Nala’s concern angrily and leaves without explaining himself.
Expresses feelings of despair and loneliness, showing vulnerability.
Rejects Nala's advice and refuses to return, expressing doubt about changing the past and lack of belief.
Reflects on his situation thoughtfully and seeks solitude to process his feelings, showing introspection.
Uses defensive and dismissive language towards Nala, indicating emotional turmoil and lack of confident decision-making.
Questions Rafiki sincerely about his identity and expresses confusion about himself.
Responds playfully and lightly to Rafiki’s teasing by telling him 'Enough already!'
Chases after Rafiki after he leaves, showing engagement and openness to communication.
Walks away initially when Rafiki follows him persistently, showing some irritation.
Thinks for a moment when questioned about his identity by Rafiki.
Expresses confusion and uncertainty about who he is.
Responds with skepticism and tries to dismiss Rafiki's words.
Chases after Rafiki after he scoots away, showing initiative.
Huffs and puffs climbing up the hill to Rafiki but perseveres.
Reluctantly accepts Rafiki’s information about his father, though expresses doubt.
Follows Rafiki through difficult jungle terrain despite challenges.
Expresses impatience by telling Rafiki to slow down and wait.
Shows anxiousness and vulnerability when seeing his reflection and questioning his identity.
Responds emotionally to the vision of his father, expresses longing and fear of abandonment.
Acknowledges his struggle with identity and shows vulnerability.
Responds to his father's vision, acknowledges his doubt about going back, but listens carefully and reflects on his identity and responsibilities.
Shows fear and desperation when the vision fades, pleading for his father not to leave, indicating emotional vulnerability but also motivation to grow.
Nuzzles with Nala, shares a sincere moment of commitment to face difficulties together.
Expresses horror and self-blame over the devastation, showing emotional openness.
Runs determinedly across difficult terrain towards Pride Rock despite harsh conditions.
Expresses horror and self-doubt upon seeing the devastation and questioning what he has done.
Acknowledges the difficulty of his task but commits to facing it with Nala's support.
Protects Timon by pushing him down behind the rock to avoid danger.
Includes friends Timon and Pumbaa in the plan, showing trust and camaraderie.
Nods in agreement to proceed despite danger, encouraging group unity.
Pushes Timon down behind the rock to avoid detection by the hyena, showing awareness and quick reaction.
Assesses the situation and decides to move forward with the plan despite the danger, demonstrating confident decision-making.
Pauses and hesitates ('I’m thinkin’... I’m thinkin’') before making a decision, indicating some uncertainty.
Passes behind Timon and Pumbaa while hyenas' attention is diverted, showing situational awareness and discretion.
No direct response or leadership shown when Scar and hyenas confront the food shortage problem, indicating passivity and lack of initiative.
Charges down the rock to confront Scar after witnessing Scar's violence against Sarabi.
Charges down Pride Rock upon witnessing Scar's treachery, confronting the antagonist with confidence.
Stands protectively near his mother, showing awareness and readiness to act in a crisis.
Tells his mother he is alive and says 'I'm home.'
Silently stalks Scar and immediately engages him physically to challenge his rule.
Desperately tries to fight off overwhelming hyenas attacking him.
Silently stalks Scar and confronts him directly, showing confidence and readiness to reclaim his place.
Lunges and tussles with Scar, repeatedly attempting to subdue him, demonstrating persistence and combat skill.
Desperately tries to fight off a large group of hyenas by himself but is overwhelmed and injured.
Struggles to maintain footing on unstable ground near the edge of a promontory while weakened, showing vulnerability and physical struggle in a critical moment.
Confronts Scar despite danger and fights to protect others.
Admits to being wrong about running away.
Screams and falls off the promontory, showing vulnerability.
Breaks free from fighting hyenas and immediately pursues Scar through flames and smoke.
Calls Scar a murderer and stalks him aggressively at the top of Pride Rock.
Breaks free of fighting hyenas and quickly scans the area for Scar's presence.
Runs after Scar through flames and smoke, scaling a steep incline to confront him.
Stalks Scar at the top of Pride Rock with determination and confidence, calling him a murderer.
Moves quickly and skillfully to flip Scar over the edge of Pride Rock using the signature 'Nala flip.'
Lets Scar go after initial suspicion, showing caution but potential hesitation.
Neutral reaction to Scar's manipulative statements and unclear intentions, suggesting uncertainty or lack of assertiveness in the moment.
Limping, slowly making his way through the rain up Pride Rock; looks out over his kingdom and lets out a magnificent roar.
Nuzzles Nala and laughs when Timon presents a gift to the newborn cub.

Limping, slowly making his way through the rain up Pride Rock, then letting out a magnificent roar and being answered by the lionesses with joyous roars, demonstrating reclaimed leadership and confidence.
Laughs at the bug gift that flies away, showing a moment of lightheartedness and ease, implying social confidence.
